title: 'Super El Nino' likely next year? What it could mean for India
description: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's climate prediction center has forecasted a "strong" El Nino event in the Northern Hemisphere from March to May 2024. There is a 1 in 3 chance that this event could be "historically strong" like the ones in 1997-98 and 2015-16. El Nino has significant impacts on global weather patterns, affecting food production, water availability, and ecosystems. In India, it typically weakens Monsoon winds and leads to reduced rainfall.

title: Mahua took bribes to ask questions in LS: BJP MP
description: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey has accused Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra of involvement in a "cash for query" scandal and has demanded an inquiry committee against her. Dubey alleges that Moitra exchanged bribes with a businessman to ask questions in Parliament in exchange for cash and gifts. Moitra responded by stating that she welcomes any motion against her once pending breach of privilege cases against ruling party members are dealt with.

title: Israel restores water supply in southern Gaza: Top developments
General strike hits normal life in Manipur
description: The strike resulted in the closure of commercial establishments and markets, while public transport services were suspended, with only a limited number of private vehicles on the roads. Inter-district public transport services also remained non-operational, according to officials.

title: What Digvijaya said as 'resignation letter' goes viral
description: Digvijaya Singh, a senior leader of the Indian National Congress party, accused the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) of spreading fake news after a social media post went viral claiming that he had resigned from the Congress. Singh reported the matter to the police and the Madhya Pradesh Congress filed a complaint stating that a fake resignation letter was circulated to create confusion. Singh emphasized his loyalty to the Congress and criticized the BJP for spreading lies.

title: 'Evil' UK nurse enjoying karaoke in jail, befriends another baby-killer
description: Lucy Letby, the UK nurse convicted of murdering seven newborn babies, has reportedly been enjoying her time in prison with her newfound friends, Shauna Hoare and Michelle Smith, both convicted of different crimes. The trio has been described as inseparable, spending time sunbathing, singing karaoke, and watching movies together.

title: Gift from Virat for 'uncle's son'? Angry Akram slams Babar
description: After the ICC World Cup match between arch-rivals India and Pakistan at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Saturday, Virat Kohli came to meet Babar Azam on the ground and gifted him a signed Team India jersey. The gesture was lauded on social media, but didn't go down well with former Pakistan captain and bowling legend Wasim Akram.

title: Adani’s new mega port can lure world’s biggest ships to India
description: Located near the southernmost tip of the country, the Vizhinjam transshipment container port — the first of its kind in India that will be inaugurated on October 15 — will allow India to grab a bigger slice of the international maritime trade currently dominated by China. It will also bolster its aspirations to be an alternative manufacturing hub by reducing logistics costs for cargo coming to and from the country.

title: Tremors in Delhi-NCR after 3.1 magnitude quake in Haryana
Skeletons from deadliest-ever pandemic contradict age-old belief
description: A new study has found that the 1918 Spanish flu primarily affected frail and unhealthy individuals, contradicting the belief that it targeted young and healthy adults. Researchers from McMaster University and the University of Colorado Boulder examined skeletal remains of individuals who died during the pandemic and found that those with active lesions were the most frail.

title: Recording of phone conversations violates privacy rights: HC
description: A woman had challenged the order passed by the Family Court, Mahasamund, on October 21, 2021, in a miscellaneous criminal case, whereby the application filed by the respondent husband under Section 311 of the CrPC to summon the witness for further cross-examination has been allowed.

title: Why Tata Motors doesn’t offer Harrier, Safari as AWD/4x4: FWD vs AWD
description: Tata Motors has no plans to introduce a 4WD SUV in the near future, but may consider it for an upcoming electric vehicle.

title: After 60 yrs, Nagaland gets 1st medical college
description: Union Health and Family Welfare Minister Mansukh Mandaviya inaugurated the first medical college in Nagaland, the Nagaland Institute of Medical Sciences and Research (NIMSR), fulfilling a long-held aspiration of the people. Mandaviya emphasized that NIMSR is not just a medical college but also a research institute, aiming to address the healthcare needs of the Naga population. The college, affiliated with Nagaland University, received permission to admit 100 MBBS students from the academic year 2023-2024. The inauguration was attended by Chief Minister Neiphiu Rio, who expressed gratitude to the central government for their support.

title: 427 runs in 20 overs & a 52-run over: Records tumble in women's T20I
description: The Chile women team's tour of Argentina couldn't have begun on a more earth-shattering note as the hosts sent records tumbling in a T20I that produced numbers of colossal proportions. The home team's victory margin in Buenos Aires on Saturday was 364 runs and the target they set Chile to chase was an unimaginable 428 in a T20 international. The Argentine openers enjoyed a net session in the middle in a 350-run partnership.

title: This festive season, clink glasses to wine made in UP
description: A winery in Uttar Pradesh, India, is set to launch its first locally made wine during the festival season. The entrepreneur behind the winery has received approval from the excise department and plans to register brand names for the products soon. The winery will offer experiential tours and produce wine from locally sourced fruits, starting with guava-based wine and later expanding to five other fruits. The facility will be run by experts from Maharashtra, and the state government has amended the excise policy to support local wine production. Another winery in Bareilly is also expected to launch its products this year.

title: Fake ED officials ‘raid’ Delhi home & ‘seize’ Rs 3 crore, 4 held
description: A family in New Delhi was targeted by a fake Enforcement Directorate (ED) raid, during which the impostors claimed to have found hawala money and confiscated Rs 3 crore in cash. The family, suspicious of the raid, contacted the police after the impostors left. A pursuit ensued, resulting in the arrest of four suspects and the recovery of Rs 1 crore. The victim had recently sold a plot of land, which is suspected to have attracted the attention of the criminals.

title: IIT-H wheels out its own driverless car
description: The shuttle cars, developed at IIT's TiHAN centre, are currently transporting students and faculty within the campus. The autonomous bikes, fitted with sensors and GPS navigation systems, can be summoned using a mobile app and can travel to the desired location without anyone riding them.

title: India to SL ferry service started; 50 on board on Day 1
description: India and Sri Lanka have launched an international passenger ferry service after almost 40 years. The service, operated by the government-owned Shipping Corporation of India, runs between Nagapattinam in India and Kankesanthurai in Jaffna, northern Sri Lanka. The high-speed craft, Cheriyapani, can carry up to 150 passengers and will make the 60 nautical mile journey in three to four hours. The service is expected to strengthen ties between the two countries and boost trade and tourism. Plans are also being considered for a similar service between Rameswaram and Talaimannar.

title: Not just most WC tons, Rohit now also has the best...
description: India captain Rohit Sharma's match-winning knock of 86 runs in 63 balls, which included 6 fours and 6 sixes, against Pakistan on Saturday in their ICC World Cup match has pushed him up to number seven in the list of leading run-getters in ODI World Cups. But besides being the batsman with most centuries in that list, Rohit is now also ahead of everyone else in another column, leaving behind even the top-ranked Sachin Tendulkar.

title: Judiciary, executive, legislature are equal: Maha speaker
description: Maharashtra assembly speaker, Rahul Narwekar, has stated that the Supreme Court did not order a decision on the disqualification of Shiv Sena MLAs within two months. Narwekar emphasized the importance of maintaining the sovereignty of the legislature and respecting the judiciary, legislature, and executive equally.

title: Kochi Corporation to crack the whip on eateries without effluent treatment plants
description: Notices issued to around 20 eateries for failure to install ETPs and for releasing untreated water into city drains

title: Heavy rain likely till tomorrow, 4 districts on orange alert today
description: Yellow alert issued on remaining 10 districts today. All districts except Kannur and Kasaragod on yellow alert on Tuesday. In Thiruvananthapuram, 875 people shifted to 21 relief camps following heavy waterlogging

title: As Gaza Deaths Rise, Ice Cream Trucks Double Up As Morgues For Bodies
description: Health officials in the Hamas-run Gaza Strip have resorted to storing the bodies of Palestinians killed by Israeli air strikes in ice cream freezer trucks because moving them to hospitals is too risky and cemeteries are short of space.

title: Gaza Deadline Over, Israel Forces Await Political Nod For Ground Assault
description: The three-hour deadline to evacuate north Gaza long over, the Israeli Defence Forces are now waiting for political green signal for the long-expected ground offensive. A new front meanwhile, is opening up on the border with Lebanon.

description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has wished "happy Navratri" to the Hindu community in his country amid a diplomatic row with India.

description: Israeli forces were Sunday readying for a looming Gaza ground invasion aimed at destroying Hamas, the Palestinian Islamist militant group that unleashed the bloodiest attack in the country's history.

title: Strong Tremors Felt In Delhi, Nearby Areas
description: Earthquake in Delhi-NCR: Delhi and its neighbouring cities were jolted on Sunday afternoon when a 3.1 magnitude earthquake struck Faridabad in Haryana.

title: "Really Moved By..." : Israel Envoy After India's Win Against Pakistan
description: Israeli Ambassador to India Naor Gilon said that he was moved by several Indians showing their "solidarity with Israel by displaying posters during the match."

title: Israel Acting "Beyond Scope Of Self-Defence" In Gaza: China
description: Israel's actions in Gaza have gone "beyond the scope of self-defence" and the Israeli government must "cease its collective punishment of the people of Gaza", China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi said in remarks published Sunday.
